results.title: Insurance Advisor (Remote)
results.description:
Where Your Passion Meets Purpose: Empowering Millions through Insurance!



Welcome to Ditto– a platform built by and for millennials– to help secure people’s finances and make an impact in people’s lives. We're not just another insurance company; we are trailblazers on a mission to empower people to make smarter financial decisions.



If you crave an exhilarating journey that challenges you, rewards your drive, and gives you the platform to build exciting initiatives, you've come to the perfect place.



Why Ditto?


The insurance industry is plagued with greed and mis-selling and spam calls. That’s why we created Ditto, where you can talk to advisors without the worries of being spammed or mis-sold. With our free consultation, no-spam policy, and honest insurance advice, one can talk to experts who care.



What Makes Us Ditto?

  • Our Mission: We give you the same insurance advice as if we were in your shoes– Ditto!! Get it?

  • Our Team: We are a team of over 200 members now, located all over India.

  • Funded by Zerodha, India’s Largest Stock Broking company: Yeah…Nithin Kamath is our neighbor.

  • Made by India's Largest Financial Newsletter: We also own one of India's largest financial newsletters–Finshots. We have 500K+ subscribers and 1M+ followers on social media, and our podcast Finshots Daily is amongst the top 3 podcasts in India!

  • LinkedIn’s Top Startup: Oh, did we mention– We won LinkedIn’s Top Startup in just one year of operating as a company.

  • Top-Rated Insurance Company: We have a whopping 4.9 rating with almost 2000 reviews on Google.


Discover Your Role at Ditto


As a vital member of Ditto’s Advisory team, you will become the friendly face of our platform, directly engaging with users to understand their requirements and provide tailored recommendations.



Your mission– should you choose to accept it– would be to accompany and support them on their insurance journey, ensuring they make informed decisions with confidence.


What’s it like being an Advisor, you ask?


  • No Sales Targets: We’ve never believed in having targets. So, feel free to push yourself as much as possible, but you won’t have a target to chase


  • No Prior Experience Required: We don’t care where you are from. Or what you’ve done. If you can speak well and are ready to learn something new, you’re in


  • No spam, No mis-selling: You will only be talking to people who’ve reached out to us through call or WhatsApp. And since we never spam customers, you won’t have to deal with unruly people either.



Choose Your Path: Team Bliss or Team Falcon


We believe in nurturing talent and catering to individual preferences. At Ditto, you have the freedom to choose between two advisory teams:



  • Team Bliss: Inside this team, you’ll be spending ~40% of your time talking to customers directly through phone calls while you spend the remaining time interacting with customers on WhatsApp. This team is ideal for individuals who like to start their working day a little late since there are two shifts in place: 12pm to 9pm or 2pm to 11pm.


  • Team Falcon: Here you’ll be spending ~60% of your time communicating with users through direct calls, with the rest being spent on WhatsApp. The typical working hours could last from 10 am to 8 pm, although you will have a lot of time for yourself in between.


You can choose between Team Bliss and Team Falcon during the application process. Also, if you are not from an insurance background, we have a rigorous two-month training program to get you up to speed.


Requirements

To thrive at Ditto, we're seeking individuals who embody passion, empathy, and a desire to make a real difference. As a valuable member of our team, you should possess:


1. Excellent Communication: Clear and effective communication is at the heart of everything we do.


2. Attention to Detail: In the world of insurance, precision matters. We need meticulous individuals who leave no room for errors.


3. Language Prowess: A good command of English empowers you to engage confidently with users from all walks of life.


4. Tech Savviness: Basic computer knowledge is necessary to leverage our tools and platforms effectively.


5. Influential Skills: Your power of persuasion can shape decisions for the better.


Perks & Benefits

At Ditto, we value and reward your contributions. As part of our team, you'll enjoy:

  • Work from Home: You can enjoy working at Ditto from the comfort of your home.

  • Opportunity for Growth: Embark on an exciting journey with the freedom to lead new advisory initiatives, impacting both your career and the company's trajectory.

  • Comprehensive Health Insurance: Your well-being matters. We've got you covered - literally.

  • Competitive Compensation: A competitive CTC of 4.5LPA (Fixed) with additional incentives based on performance. The median salary of our advisors post-training tallies up to Rs. 43,000 a month.

  • Wellness leaves: Take a break when you need it. No questions asked. Your mental health is a priority to us!

  • Off-sites & Events: We play hard as well as work hard. Join us for some fun and games after hours.



Our Interview Process: Seamless & Fast


We respect your time and endeavor to streamline the hiring process while ensuring a thorough evaluation. Our interview process comprises four rounds, all completed within a maximum of 1 week:


HR Introductory Call: A warm welcome to get to know each other better.


Task 1: Showcase your skills and potential.


Task 2: Dive deeper into the role and showcase your expertise.


Final Managerial Round: The last step towards joining our team.


Once you fill in the details in the application form, you will be required to record a Short Video Resume. Submitting this video resume is Mandatory. If you do face hassles in recording a video CV, please send an email to careers@joinditto.in

Please Note - Beware of fraudulent Recruitment Agents. We do not charge any amount for any given purpose prior to an application for a role or at the time of any ensuing recruitment process. . For any queries, please contact careers@joinditto.in

results.title: Luxury Trip Designer ACP (Remote)
results.location: San Francisco, United States of America
results.description:
Unlock your remote work journey: you shine, we match you! Once you apply, you will be receiving your profile link in the next 24hrs. After applying you will need to complete your profile, receive follow-ups from our talent advisors, and our AI platform will do the rest.
Summary:
We are seeking for a Luxury Trip Designer with a deep passion for travel and an extensive knowledge of the world's top luxury destinations. Your expertise isn't just about knowing places but connecting with the heart and soul of each location, ensuring each trip is not only luxurious but authentically engaging. With a scrappy, entrepreneurial spirit, you're ready to tackle challenges creatively and build trips with enthusiasm and precision. Your role is pivotal in designing trips that not only meet but exceed the expectations of our discerning audience, ensuring each journey is a testament to our brand's commitment to excellence, authenticity, and sustainability.

Responsibilities:

  • Design luxury-level trips across all seven continents.
  • Interact with our customers as they ideate their trips. Work with them on itinerary design and modification as you close sales.
  • Utilize your broad knowledge of destinations to create immersive, authentic experiences that cater to a high-end clientele.
  • Leverage your contacts with local operators and direct suppliers to ensure exclusive access and exceptional service throughout our trips.
  • Exhibit a scrappy, entrepreneurial mindset, adept at navigating the complexities of trip design with innovation and agility.
  • Collaborate closely with the Trip Development and Operations teams to ensure the seamless execution of each journey, from ideation to completion.
  • Stay ahead of travel trends and market insights, ensuring our offerings are not only relevant but pioneering in the luxury travel space, are low-impact and sustainable.
  • Negotiate the best rates and highest value on behalf of clients.
  • Contribute to the continual refinement of our trip development processes, embodying a spirit of excellence and innovation in all aspects of your work.

Qualification
  • Proficiency in English language skills at either B2 or C1 level is required
  • English Resume is required
  • 5+ years of experience in trip design, with a proven track record of creating extraordinary travel experiences.
  • Extensive knowledge of global destinations, luxury travel trends, and consumer insights.
  • Strong network of contacts among local operators, direct suppliers, and industry insiders.
  • Ability to work with clients and close trips.
  • Entrepreneurial spirit, with the ability to thrive in a startup environment—adaptable, proactive, and driven.
  • Comfortable with a remote-first environment.
  • Exceptional communication skills, with the ability to convey the unique value of our trips to both partners and clients.
  • Proficiency in Salesforce CRM and Google Workplace, with a tech-savvy approach to trip design and execution.

A business analyst is responsible for analyzing the business needs of clients and stakeholders to help to identify business problems and proper solutions.

Salary Range: 2 LPA- 3.6 LPA


Experience: 1+ Year experience


Preferred Qualification: B.Sc. (CS or Technology) or M.Sc.

results.title: Head of Country - Egypt
results.description:
Abwaab | Head of Country - EgyptLocation - Cairo, Egypt

About Us:


Do you want to join a startup that is changing the way students learn across our region? Are you excited to witness the thrill of building a hyper-growth tech company?


As we work towards this mission, Abwaab is looking for an experienced & passionate, impact-driven and motivated individual who is bold, and has a growth mindset to drive our business forward in Egypt.


Job Overview:


As the Head of Country, you will be responsible for overseeing and leading all aspects of our operations in the region. With a team of over 100 talented individuals, you will play a pivotal role in driving the company's growth, ensuring operational excellence, and fostering a positive work culture.


Key Responsibilities:


  • Provide visionary leadership to the Egypt team, aligning them with the company's goals and fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement.

  • Develop and execute comprehensive strategic plans for the Egyptian market, identifying opportunities for growth and market expansion.

  • Grow our business in Egypt to make it the leading learning institution in the country.

  • Oversee day-to-day operations, ensuring efficiency, quality, and compliance with company policies and industry regulations.

  • Lead, mentor, and inspire a diverse team, fostering a positive work environment and promoting professional development.

  • Build and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, including government bodies, educational institutions, and industry partners.

  • Stay abreast of market trends, competitor activities, and educational policies to inform strategic decision-making.

  • Work closely with the finance team to manage budgets, control costs, and drive financial performance.

  • Set and manage targets for the Egypt team, ensuring alignment with overall company objectives.

  • Develop and implement effective sales and marketing strategies to drive business growth in the Egyptian market.

  • Work closely with central teams on operations and forecasting, ensuring seamless coordination and alignment with company-wide initiatives.



Requirements:


  • Proven experience in a leadership role, preferably as a Country Manager or Head of Operations.

  • Strong understanding of the local market, with the ability to build strong partnerships with key stakeholders

  • Strong understanding of the EdTech industry, with direct experience being a plus.

  • Experience in navigating dynamic and fast-paced work environments, utilizing analytical skills to drive decision-making agility.

  • Exceptional leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.

  • Strategic thinker with a track record of driving successful business outcomes.

  • Proven ability to manage and motivate large teams effectively.

  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field; MBA or advanced degree is a plus.

You are a results focused Electrical Tradesperson with experience within mining, processing, or manufacturing operations. Liberty Bell Bay is Australia's only ferro-alloy producer, operating four submerged arc furnaces and a Sinter Plant to produce high-carbon ferromanganese, silicomanganese and sinter.

About Bell Bay
This role will be based at Bell Bay, 50km north of Launceston. Tasmania offers a unique lifestyle choice with short commute times, easy access to a wide range of leisure activities, affordable housing, well-regarded schools, a vibrant cultural and sporting scene and welcoming communities.

Présent dans 12 pays (Europe, Moyen-Orient, Asie), nous travaillons sur la production et la distribution d'électricité bas-carbone, à travers le développement des énergies nucléaires et renouvelables. Nous participons également à la modernisation des réseaux électriques et l'électrification des usages, à travers l'hydrogène pour décarboner les secteurs des transports et de l'industrie.

Dans le cadre du développement de nos activités sur le site de la Base Navale de Toulon Assystem recherche un(e) Responsable Technique CVC pour le suivi et la surveillance de réalisation de marchés de travaux.

🔹 L’approvisionnement et la fabrication

Vous assurez également la préparation et l’animation des réunions techniques de suivi des études et travaux ; vous participez aux réunions OPC et de synthèse et réalisez le reporting des points durs et des actions à coordonner.

🔹 Une flexibilité et un équilibre entre vie professionnelle et vie privée grâce à des politiques de travail flexible et des programmes de soutien aux employés.

We lead the mechanical design activities with both our external and internal partners in order to reach the project goals. Our projects range from new developments to customer adaptations of existing products, starting from quotation phase to after series introduction.
You will be responsible for leading project teams and activities for the mechanical technological development of electronic control systems.

In your role you will:
• Lead mechanical design activities for electronic control units used in automotive applications in an international team, starting from quotation until start of production;
• Be in charge to be the main technical contact person for mechanical design towards customers and suppliers;
• Estimate product, tooling and engineering cost;
• Track and control quality, budget and timing targets;
• Cooperate with international development partners and Bosch production plants;
• Prepare and maintain project documents according to Bosch quality system;
• Report regularly to management about project status (risks, issues etc.);
• Meet regularly with the customers (OEM’s).

Qualifications

• At least 2 years of experience in project management for the automotive industry and mechanical design;
• Knowledge of existing design methods like FMEA, DFMA, V-Model;
• Eager to work with the newest automotive technologies, understand complex systems and shape the behavior of the future cars;
• Proactive and you adapt easily to new development environment, but don’t worry, we will be there every step of the way, supporting each other;
• Self-motivated and take ownership of your tasks and projects;
• Team player and offering and receiving feedback comes naturally;
• Not afraid to think outside the box and try to find creative approaches to your challenges;
• English – a good level is mandatory;

Nice to have:
• Willing to travel;
• German - it is not mandatory, but it is an advantage.

Additional Information

Hybrid working is the new way of working! We offer super nice and cozy office spaces, however you can also work from home if you feel like it (70% remote work)

Our #LikeABosch Benefits:

  • 25 days of annual leave
  • Medical subscription
  • Accident insurance
  • A monthly budget which can be used for several different services on an online benefit platform
  • Annual bonus
  • Relocation bonus
  • Lunch discounts
  • Sport activities and well-being initiatives
  • Technical and soft skills trainings
  • Access to e-learning platforms
  • Local and Global career development programs
  • Bookster subscription

results.title: (Junior) Projektmanager*in Produktion Referenzmaterial in Teil- oder Vollzeit (m/w/d)
results.description:
Unternehmensbeschreibung

LGC Standards ist ein Unternehmensbereich der LGC Group, dem britischen National Measurement Institute für chemische und bioanalytische Messungen. Wir sind ein weltweit führendes Herstellungs- und Dienstleistungsunternehmen von Qualitätssicherungs- und Forschungsinstrumenten, die den analytischen Bedarf in mehr als 120 Ländern weltweit decken. Wir nutzen unser Fachwissen, um nach den höchsten Standards zu produzieren, einschließlich der nach ISO/IEC 17025 hergestellten und nach ISO 17034 akkreditierten Reihen.

Unser breites Angebot an Referenzmaterialien und Eignungsprüfungsprogrammen wird durch unsere Erfahrung im Outsourcing und im Zollwesen ergänzt, wodurch wir in der Lage sind, uns schnell anzupassen und maßgeschneiderte Lösungen anzubieten, die den analytischen Anforderungen unserer Kundschaft entsprechen. Wir sind innovativ und setzen Wissenschaft ein, um die Sicherheit und Integrität von Produkten und Dienstleistungen zu gewährleisten, ganz im Sinne unserer Vision von „Science for a Safer World“ (Wissenschaft für eine sicherere Welt).

Stellenbeschreibung

Als (Junior) Projektmanager*in steuerst du die vorausschauende Planung, die Durchführung und laufende Überwachung von Projekten im Bereich Produktion von Referenzmaterial am Standort Luckenwalde. Du übernimmst die gesamte Projektkommunikation und agierst als Schnittstelle zwischen unseren internationalen Kundenunternehmen und den relevanten Abteilungen. Du begeisterst dich für Wissenschaft und hast Interesse an einer Tätigkeit mit direktem Kundenkontakt? Wir freuen uns darauf, von dir zu hören!

Deine Aufgaben

  • Erstellen von Projektpläne (Zeit und Kosten) basierend auf dem vorgegebenen Scope
  • Umfassende Betreuung von kundenspezifischen Projekten, Projektcontrolling und Projektdokumentation
  • Bearbeitung von Kundenanfragen und Klärung technischer Rückfragen
  • Verlässliche Ansprechperson für Kundenunternehmen & Customer Service und dadurch kontinuierliche Pflege von Kundenbeziehungen
  • Kommunikation innerhalb des Teams sowie interne, bereichsübergreifende Zusammenarbeit innerhalb der Projekte
  • Koordination der Aufgabenbereiche in den übertragenen Projekten

Qualifikationen

Das wünschen wir uns

  • Kenntnisse und Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement
  • Teamfähigkeit und Schnittstellenkompetenz
  • Selbstständige, prozess-, zielorientierte und strukturierte Arbeitsweise
  • Kommunikationsstärke und Eigeninitiative
  • Hohe Organisationsfähigkeit sowie Qualitätsbewusstsein
  • Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

Deine Vorteile

  • Umfangreiche Einarbeitung und Mentoring für einen gelungenen Start
  • Unbefristeter Arbeitsvertrag, betriebliche Altersvorsorge und attraktive Arbeitgeberzuschüsse, wie z.B. JobRad, Technikleasingprogramm sowie Corporate Benefits
  • Möglichkeit, in Teilzeit (35h/Woche) oder in Vollzeit zu arbeiten
  • Verantwortungsvolle Aufgaben und individuelle Entwicklungs- und Karrieremöglichkeiten in einem innovativen, internationalen Unternehmen
  • Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Privatleben durch flexible, familienfreundliche Arbeitszeiten
  • Offene Unternehmenskultur, in der Integrität, Respekt sowie Leidenschaft und Neugierde für zukunftsweisende, kreative Lösungen im Mittelpunkt stehen
  • Umfassende Mitarbeiterangebote zum Thema Gesundheitsmanagement sowie online Angebote für Kinderbetreuung und Lernförderung
  • Gute Verkehrsanbindung an die Hauptstadtregion Berlin sowie Umzugshilfe für Kandidat*innen von außerhalb der Region
  • LGC fördert die umweltfreundliche Mobilität durch Bezuschussung des Jobtickets (Deutschlandticket) und kostenlose Nutzung der Stromtankstellen am Standort

Werde jetzt Teil von LGC und bringe unser Ziel "Wissenschaft für eine sicherere Welt" weiter voran! Wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Zusätzliche Informationen

ÜBER LGC:

LGC ist ein führendes, globales Life Science Unternehmen, das unternehmenskritische Komponenten und Lösungen für wachstumsstarke Anwendungsbereiche in der Humanmedizin und anderen Märkten weltweit anbietet. Unser hochwertiges Produktportfolio besteht aus unternehmenskritischen Tools für die Genomanalyse und für Qualitätssicherungsanwendungen, die in der Regel in die Produkte und Arbeitsabläufe unserer Kundschaft eingebettet sind und aufgrund ihrer Leistung, Qualität und ihres breiten Spektrums geschätzt werden.

UNSERE WERTE

  • Leidenschaft
  • Neugierde
  • Integrität
  • Brillianz
  • Respekt

CHANCENGLEICHHEIT

LGC setzt sich für Offenheit, gegenseitigen Respekt und gleiche Beschäftigungschancen ein ungeachtet von ethnischer oder sozialer Herkunft, Gender, Alter, Religion, jeglicher Beeinträchtigungen oder sexuellen Orientierung und Identität. Wir engagieren uns für eine integrative Kultur und sind fest davon überzeugt, dass die Vielfältigkeit individueller Werte und Perspektiven den Erfolg und die Qualität unserer Arbeit ausmacht.

Wir wachsen stetig weiter und sind aktiv auf der Suche nach Menschen, die mit Leidenschaft etwas bewirken wollen. Mehr Informationen über LGC und unsere offenen Stellen unter www.lgcgroup.com

#scienceforasaferworld

results.title: Senior Pre Sales Engineer
results.description:
Company Description

Epsilon is a global leader in outcome-based marketing. As a company at the forefront of marketing innovation, Epsilon provides a unique blend of data, technology, and services, driving measurable results and business growth for its clients. With over 9000 employees in 60 countries and rich 50-year history delivering cutting edge technology, data, and media solutions, Epsilon has a vast client portfolio in Automotive, Telecommunications, Retail, Fast Moving Consumer Goods, Financial Services, Healthcare, Travel, and more.

Did you know that Epsilon:

  • Created the first ever travel rewards program for PanAm Airlines?

  • Built Apple’s first CRM database?

  • Is the technology behind the loyalty programs of Marriott, Walgreens, Citi, and more?

  • Is ranked number 1 in IDC’s MarketScape Assessment for global DSPs and Leader in Forrester’s global Loyalty management software vendors?

Job Description

The Sales Engineering team seeks qualified candidates proficient in identifying customer pain points, devising solutions, and articulating the company's value proposition while overcoming technical objections. Ideal candidates leverage technical and sales expertise to understand customer needs, aid in developing sales strategies, and collaborate across teams. Demonstrated experience in delivering compelling cloud solution demonstrations is crucial.

The team prioritizes consultative selling, tailoring solutions to customer needs to foster lasting relationships. Candidates should drive new customer acquisition and revenue within defined territories, possessing technical credibility in marketing technology solutions. Strong grasp of solutions, network architectures, and ability to address client pain points is key. Successful candidates execute territory coverage plans and consistently meet quarterly KPIs and revenue targets.

Responsibilities:

  • Accountable for supporting new business and cultivating relationships across multiple verticals in the Latin America region, exceeding quota goals by actively engaging in every stage of the sales cycle, including prospecting, discovery, qualification, and deal closure.

  • Play an integral role in expanding our market presence throughout Latin America by comprehending customer needs and contributing to the formulation of technical sales strategies.

  • Deliver live product demonstrations both in the field and through video conferencing, ensuring customers have a clear understanding of our offerings.

  • Offer pre-sales assistance to clients in configuring and implementing our services, ensuring a seamless onboarding experience.

  • Participate in comprehensive product, sales, and role-specific training programs to maintain a high level of effectiveness in your position.

  • Contribute to the creation of educational content aimed at enhancing customer understanding of our solutions.

  • Assist in crafting effective responses to requests for proposals (RFPs), showcasing our capabilities and value proposition.

  • Provide pre-sales support to Client Development teams, facilitating their efforts in securing new business.

  • Conduct thorough research on prospects' business and technology landscape prior to engagement, ensuring informed and meaningful interactions.

  • Collaborate in the development and deployment of customer proof-of-concept (POC) and proof-of-value (POV) solutions, demonstrating the tangible benefits of our offerings.

Qualifications

  • Proficiency in Spanish and English, enabling clear communication in professional environments.

  • At least 3 years of experience in a comparable role, demonstrating a solid foundation in sales or related fields.

  • Experience in or familiarity with the relevant industry.

  • A strong understanding of advertising technology and marketing-related technologies is necessary.

  • Proven track record of customer interaction, highlighting the importance of customer-facing experience.

  • Experience conducting demonstrations for both technical and business-focused audiences.

  • Exceptional written communication skills in both Spanish and English are imperative for effective correspondence.

  • Comfortable staying updated with technology trends and understanding how our products evolve.

  • Demonstrated openness, curiosity, and willingness to explore new ideas and methodologies.

  • Willingness and ability to travel domestically and internationally to fulfill job responsibilities.

Additional Information

We offer:

  • Being part of a leading team in an industry in full growth and with great international projection

  • Work modality: Hibrid (2 days a week in person)

  • Holidays: 15 days

  • Medical insurance

  • Language training (English and/or Portuguese)

results.title: DevOps/Pipeline Lead
results.description:
Company Description

Techland is one of the biggest and best-known Polish game developers with studios in Wroclaw and Warsaw. For over 30 years, we've carried a tradition of providing gamers with unforgettable experiences. We're an international team of over 400 highly-skilled professionals driven by a passion for gaming, always striving for the best quality.

We’re fueled by the support of our global community built on the foundation of successful AAA franchises such as Call of Juarez, Dead Island, or Dying Light. The gamers' trust in our games has resulted in our newest project, Dying Light 2 Stay Human, selling more than 5 million copies across all platforms within the first month after release.

On top of continuously growing the world of Dying Light through a robust post-launch support plan for Dying Light 2 Stay Human, we're also working on an unannounced AAA Open World Action RPG set in a brand new fantasy universe; our biggest project to date.

Techland's mission strictly determines every aspect of our work: we want to create unforgettable experiences.

The Online Services Team is a growing team which operates within the Technology Department. They are dedicated to developing and maintaining online services for our company's video games, as well as backend and live operations tools . We are looking for a talented Backend Developer to join our ranks

Job Description

Your daily tasks:

  • designing and implementing CI/CD solutions aimed at crafting an efficient and stable environment for Developers
  • designing, implementing and supporting tools for data exchange with DCC software
  • managing a team of highly skilled devops engineers and technology programmers,
  • mentoring and motivating team members, delivering detailed code reviews,
  • providing clean, robust, reusable solutions, and create all necessary technical documentation,
  • providing time estimates and task breakdowns,
  • helping the team to meet all necessary requirements (functionality, scope, performance etc.),
  • cooperating closely with other departments (engine, game, publishing, etc),
  • constantly identifying areas for improvement and driving all changes that are required.

Qualifications

You meet our expectations if you have:=

  • experience in developing, implementing and maintaining CI/CD solutions for AAA titles,
  • experience with version control systems (preferable p4), tests and processes automations and asset pipelines
  • good knowledge of scripting languages (eg: Python, PowerShell),
  • knowledge of c++ is a plus,
  • cross-platform experience,
  • experience in leading and mentoring development teams,
  • experience with code reviews,
  • excellent organization and time management skills,
  • excellent interpersonal and communication skills,
  • very good command of English.

Additional Information

What we can offer:

  • a wide array of benefits: private medical care, life insurance, relocation support, pro-health campaigns, psychological support, gifts for different occasions, bonuses,
  • an outstanding work atmosphere in a highly-skilled team of professionals, with flexible working hours, no dress code, and full support of the dedicated HR Business Partner,
  • a constant stream of company newsletters, PR & project updates so you will always be in the know,
  • many opportunities for personal development: a dedicated development budget for each employee, extra two paid days for training and CSR, stable career paths, extensive internal and external training, and financing of English and Polish language classes,
  • state-of-the-art offices filled with chillout zones, a fully equipped kitchen, a gym (Wrocław office), and a free underground car park (Wrocław office).

Byborg Enterprises is an equal employment opportunity employer. We consider individuals for employment based on their skills, abilities and experience. results.title: Delineante Junior de Infraestructuras Lineales
results.description:
Descripción de la empresa

En AECOM, ofrecemos un mundo mejor.

No importa si se trata de mejorar los traslados, mantener las luces encendidas, dar acceso a agua potable o transformar los horizontes, creemos que cada infraestructura tiene el poder de mejorar las comunidades y la vida de las personas.

Somos la empresa de infraestructura de confianza a nivel mundial, y como tal, reunimos a las mejores personas, ideas y soluciones digitales, así como los mejores conocimientos técnicos. Nos asociamos con nuestros clientes para convertir sus ambiciones en acción y cambiar el mundo para mejorarlo.

Nuestros clientes confían en nosotros para aglutinar los mejores profesionales, ideas, conocimiento técnico y soluciones digitales para nuestros proyectos en transporte, edificación, agua, medio ambiente y nuevas energías. Únete a nosotros y forma parte de un equipo global -más de 47.000 empleados- que está dirigido por un objetivo común: crear un mundo mejor.

Enterprise Capabilities.

Enterprise Capabilities (EC) es el grupo estratégico de AECOM destinado a ser el motor y elemento clave en la política de colaboración de las diferentes Regiones y Líneas de Negocio de la empresa. Está compuesto por equipos de alta capacitación técnica, que contribuyen decisivamente a la ejecución de algunos de los Proyectos más emblemáticos de Ingeniería por todo el mundo. EC está en pleno proceso de expansión en Europa, y está buscando ampliar de forma continua y sostenible el tamaño de varios de sus equipos, como es el de Puentes y Estructuras en España. Dicho crecimiento se debe a la implementación con éxito de la estrategia de colaboración con nuestros clientes internos de AECOM en regiones como EEUU, Canadá, Australia, Nueva Zelanda, Latinoamérica, etc.

Descripción del empleo

Estamos buscando un Delineante Junior para diseños de Infraestructuras Civiles, para una variedad de proyectos, entre otros autopistas y vías ferroviarias, que se incorporaría que nuestro experimentado y ambicioso equipo de Infraestructuras Lineales. Trabajamos en diversas fases de diseño, desde estudios de viabilidad hasta ingeniería de detalle, en una amplia gama de proyectos. Nuestros clientes pertenecen a los sectores privado y público e incluyen Acuerdos marco de larga duración con numerosas Autoridades Locales, y comisiones de trabajo de Design and Build para grandes Contratistas. Nuestra oficina cuenta con una sólida suma de exitosos diseños durante muchos años para Estados Unidos y Australia, por no mencionar Canadá u Oriente Medio. Si eres seleccionado tendrás la oportunidad de trabajar en algunos de los proyectos de transporte más icónicos del mundo, lo cual constituye una gran oportunidad para un Delineante de CAD que quiera impulsar su carrera profesional en Infraestructuras Lineales dentro de un ambiente internacional, con grandes oportunidades de aprender nuevas plataformas de software digitales.

Las responsabilidades de este puesto serían:

  • Análisis y adherencia a los estándares de CAD del proyecto.
  • Preparar planos en 2D y/o 3D, partiendo de croquis, notas y ejemplos previos.
  • Trabajo en plataformas de software de colaboración en proyectos de ingeniería (i.e., ProjectWise, BIM360, Autodesk Construction Cloud, etc.).
  • Hacer el chequeo de calidad de los trabajos desarrollados, según el procedimiento que aplique para cada proyecto.
  • Trabajo en un ambiente basado en el trabajo de equipo, lo cual implica la coordinación con otros empleados de diferentes oficinas.
  • Desarrollo de sus responsabilidades bajo una supervisión razonable.

Requisitos

Requerimientos:

  • Conocimiento de software de CAD, preferiblemente AutoCAD y/o MicroStation. Las acreditaciones y certificaciones se considerarán positivamente.
  • Se considerará positivamente la experiencia laboral o formativa en modelado usando Autodesk Civil 3D o Bentley OpenRoads Designer.
  • Experiencia en el uso de plataformas de colaboración, como Autodesk Construction Cloud,BIM360, o Bentley ProjectWise.
  • Nivel intermedio (real) de inglés (hablado y escrito).
  • La experiencia trabajando en proyectos de clientes de las Autoridades de Transporte en USA, Canadá y Australia se considerará positivamente.

Formación mínima deseada:

  • Ciclo Formativo Grado Superior.

results.title: Software Engineer
results.description:
Company Description

Although you might see this job advert being based in Birmingham, we'll consider candidates who are also happy to work from our London and Belfast offices.

We're ASOS. We blend our flair for fashion with our love of cutting- edge technology, but more importantly were interested in how we can bring the best out of you.

We exist to give people the confidence to be whoever they want to be, and that goes for our people too. At ASOS, you're free to be your true self without judgment, and channel your creativity into a platform used by millions.

Through our Be Diverse goal, we’ll drive diversity, equity and inclusion across every aspect of our business, with a focus on leadership representation and ensuring every ASOSer can be their authentic self at work.

Our initial targets are focused on achieving 50% female and over 15% ethnic minority representation across our combined leadership team by 2023, at every leadership level by 2030 and over 40% female representation in engineering, product and science (technology) roles by 2030

Job Description

Here at ASOS, we want to give everyone the confidence to be their best self, because, when you're at your best, you can achieve amazing things.

Our Technology team pioneer incredible solutions that change the way our millions of customers can access fashion. We believe that fashion can make you look, feel and be the best version of you and it's this feeling of empowerment that we want our ASOSers to experience while working with us.

Our ASOSers reflect the diverse society they live in; we celebrate our differences and welcome people from all different walks of life. We're looking for people who can live and breathe our values of being Authentic, Brave, Creative and Disciplined and we don't care about labels - we recognise there are endless ways to be 'you'.

Sound like a place you'd love to be? Come and join us!

Would you like be involved in designing and developing the systems that handle all of ASOS payment processing? The Payments platform team are responsible for complex integrations with a wide variety of payments providers. In our team you'll be working in an incredible depth of detail where you'll fully understand the ins and outs of how the full payments lifecycle works.

  • We process 1000's of transactions per minute accurately and securely.
  • We're passionate about using the latest and best tech and working practices, and as part of our platform you'll receive regular security training and opportunities to work on performance problems at serious scale.
  • If you're looking for great challenges and an environment where you'll be encouraged and supported to continuously experiment and learn new things, this could be the place for you!

At ASOS, we take real pride in our best-in -class microservices architecture, and we are looking for passionate and talented Engineers to support and deliver the innovative software which makes ASOS awesome!

We have 30 engineering platforms operating at hyper-scale receiving thousands of requests per second, and as a Software Engineer, you'll work as part of strong cross functional Agile teams driving quality and technology, bringing your skills and experience to share with the team. From problem solving to new concept ideas, you have the genuine opportunity to unleash your full potential and creativity on a variety of ASOS software projects.

What we're using:

  • Latest versions of .NET (C#)
  • Azure DevOps to manage work items and CI/CD pipelines
  • Microsoft Azure to host our service infrastructure across multiple regions
  • Infrastructure as code tools to ensure our infrastructure is defined in a declarative manner
  • Software Craftsmanship to drive our behaviours and technical practices (XP)
  • SRE practices to improve how we operate services
  • Scrum & Kanban as our frameworks to deliver our products

What you will be doing:

  • Work as part of an enthusiastic and motivated agile development team that takes pride in delivering high-quality software into production
  • Frequently delivering new features that delight millions of customers across the globe
  • Ensuring our services are simple to operate with the goal of minimising the impact of any incidents to our customers
  • Ensuring our services can scale to cater for sales events such as our Flash Sales and Black Friday that can process over a million orders an hour
  • Writing high-quality code using a test-first approach
  • Working in a high-trust, cross-functional team to deliver software and learn from one another
  • Continuously look for opportunities to improve our products and ways of working
  • Contribute to our engineering community to improve software across the whole of ASOS
  • Participate in community sessions such as brown-bags, hackathons, to learn and share your knowledge with the aim of driving engineering improvements and innovation
  • Supporting our culture by championing Diversity, Equity & Inclusion strategies

Qualifications

What you will need (please don't treat this as a checklist, these are our desirables, not must haves):

  • A desire to develop simple and maintainable solutions that are aligned to modern engineering patterns and practices
  • Hands-on experience of automated testing practices e.g., TDD/ATDD/BDD
  • Able to design and implement cloud-native distributed systems that leverage RESTful APIs, messaging and streaming
  • Proven experience in Agile and XP methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, pair-programming)
  • Experience of operating microservices in a production environment
  • Able to define continuous delivery pipelines to ensure software can be delivered reliably & efficiently to production
  • Knowledge of at least one cloud provider e.g., Azure, AWS, GCP

Additional Information

What's in it for you?

  • Competitive salary, pension, and private medical care scheme
  • Performance related bonus
  • Flex benefits allowance - which you can chose to take as extra cash, or use towards other benefits
  • 25 days paid annual leave + an extra day for your birthday
  • Employee discount (hello ASOS discount!)
  • Tech Develops - our internal tech focussed skills development programme to focus on your personal growth as a technologist
  • Opportunity to represent ASOS at industry leading events
  • Opportunity to help shape and drive our DE&I initiatives in Tech (like our WIT movement and Diversity mentoring in Tech)
  • Opportunity to make an impact from day one and work with the latest in cutting edge of technology

Our Commitments

We want our people to be whoever they want to be. That’s why we’re committed to creating a truly inclusive culture at ASOS, but how’re we doing it?

We’re proud members of Inclusive Companies, are Disability Confident Committed and have signed the Business in the Community Race at Work Charter. We’ve also recently been placed 8th in the Inclusive Top 50 Companies Employer List too.

We have several employee networks that operate as safe spaces, to help support and celebrate our people, find out more here.

How can we support you to be your best self? Our Talent team will be happy to provide support e.g. if you need additional time to prepare for an assessment or you have requirements for any part of the interview/hiring process - just let us know by email or phone, whatever works best for you. It’s also our policy to interview all candidates with a disability who meet the minimum requirements for roles they have applied to.

If you have any questions about the policies we have in place to support our employees (e.g. our parental leave approach), just let our Talent team know.

results.title: Business Development Manager (acquirers)
results.description:
Business Development Manager - Accelerate High-Risk E-commerce Growth and Champion Global Financial Freedom

Hello, strategy mastermind and relationship virtuoso! Our innovative fintech firm is creating waves in the high-risk e-commerce sector, transforming global money movement. We're in search of driven professionals with a solid understanding of high-risk e-commerce industries like gambling and betting to fortify our mission. If our company manifesto resonates with your enthusiasm for forging strategic alliances and driving growth in this niche market, we invite you to join us as a Business Development Manager. Together, we can redefine financial freedom for businesses worldwide!

Responsibilities:

  • Relationship Building: Establish and nurture relationships with potential partners - with acquirers and banks, stakeholders, within the high-risk e-commerce landscape, embodying our pioneering brand.

  • Competitive Analysis: Conduct in-depth analysis to understand industry trends within high-risk e-commerce sectors, identifying opportunities and challenges to inform business strategy.

  • Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with internal teams to align business development strategies with our company objectives and the dynamics of the high-risk e-commerce market.

  • Proposal Development: Craft persuasive proposals and presentations tailored to potential partners and clients in high-risk e-commerce sectors.

  • Negotiation: Skillfully negotiate contracts and agreements, ensuring mutual benefit and compliance with company policies and industry regulations.

Skill Requirements:

  • Proven experience in business development or a similar role, specifically within with acquirers and banks the high-risk e-commerce fintech or financial services sector, akin to industries such as gambling and betting.

  • Exceptional communication and negotiation skills, with a knack for building robust relationships.

  • Strategic thinking and analytical prowess, with a deep understanding of the unique challenges and opportunities within the high-risk e-commerce sector.

  • Excellent presentation skills, with the ability to compellingly pitch ideas and strategies to a niche market.

  • Capacity to thrive under pressure, inspiring others with your vision and enthusiasm.

Perks:

  • Impactful Work: Contribute to one of the most ambitious fintech projects in the high-risk e-commerce world.

  • Cutting-Edge Tech: Utilize the latest technology and tools to support your business development efforts.

  • Professional Growth: Seize opportunities for career development and advancement within our rapidly growing team.

  • Learning Budget: Receive at least 50% support for your learning expenses (after the probation period).

  • Paid Lunches: Recharge your strategic powers with daily meals.

  • Flexible Working Hours: Balance your demanding work with downtime, thanks to our flexible scheduling.

  • Stunning Office: Operate from our stunning Pardaugava office, complete with a serene lake view.

  • Exceptional Company Culture: Join a supportive team that values innovative thinking and collaboration.

Join us on our quest to transform the world of high-risk e-commerce finance and empower extraordinary talent. Apply now to become our Business Development Manager and help us shape the future of financial freedom while navigating the thrilling challenges of our niche sector!

results.title: Pre Sales Engineer
results.description:
Company Description

Epsilon is a global leader in outcome-based marketing. As a company at the forefront of marketing innovation, Epsilon provides a unique blend of data, technology, and services, driving measurable results and business growth for its clients. With over 9000 employees in 60 countries and rich 50-year history delivering cutting edge technology, data, and media solutions, Epsilon has a vast client portfolio in Automotive, Telecommunications, Retail, Fast Moving Consumer Goods, Financial Services, Healthcare, Travel, and more.

Did you know that Epsilon:

  • Created the first ever travel rewards program for PanAm Airlines?

  • Built Apple’s first CRM database?

  • Is the technology behind the loyalty programs of Marriott, Walgreens, Citi, and more?

  • Is ranked number 1 in IDC’s MarketScape Assessment for global DSPs and Leader in Forrester’s global Loyalty management software vendors?

Job Description

The Sales Engineering team is actively recruiting candidates who can adeptly identify customer pain points, devise tailored solutions, and effectively communicate the value proposition of the company. The ideal candidate will combine technical expertise with sales acumen to understand customer requirements and collaborate across various teams. Essential skills include delivering compelling demonstrations of cloud solutions and adopting a consultative approach to understand customer needs. The team focuses on acquiring new customers and driving recurring revenue in specific geographic territories, requiring candidates to possess a technical background and demonstrate proficiency in marketing technology solutions. Successful candidates will be self-starters capable of executing territory coverage plans and consistently achieving quarterly KPIs and revenue targets.

Responsibilities

  • Accountable for supporting new business and cultivating relationships across multiple verticals in the Latin America region, exceeding quota goals by actively engaging in every stage of the sales cycle, including prospecting, discovery, qualification, and deal closure.

  • Play an integral role in expanding our market presence throughout Latin America by comprehending customer needs and contributing to the formulation of technical sales strategies.

  • Deliver live product demonstrations both in the field and through video conferencing, ensuring customers have a clear understanding of our offerings.

  • Offer pre-sales assistance to clients in configuring and implementing our services, ensuring a seamless onboarding experience.

  • Participate in comprehensive product, sales, and role-specific training programs to maintain a high level of effectiveness in your position.

  • Contribute to the creation of educational content aimed at enhancing customer understanding of our solutions.

  • Assist in crafting effective responses to requests for proposals (RFPs), showcasing our capabilities and value proposition.

  • Provide pre-sales support to Client Development teams, facilitating their efforts in securing new business.

  • Conduct thorough research on prospects' business and technology landscape prior to engagement, ensuring informed and meaningful interactions.

  • Collaborate in the development and deployment of customer proof-of-concept (POC) and proof-of-value (POV) solutions, demonstrating the tangible benefits of our offerings.

Qualifications

  • Proficiency in Spanish and English, enabling clear communication in professional environments.

  • At least 1 year of experience in a comparable role, demonstrating a solid foundation in sales or related fields.

  • Experience in or familiarity with the relevant industry.

  • A strong understanding of advertising technology and marketing-related technologies is necessary.

  • Proven track record of customer interaction, highlighting the importance of customer-facing experience.

  • Experience conducting demonstrations for both technical and business-focused audiences.

  • Exceptional written communication skills in both Spanish and English are imperative for effective correspondence.

  • Comfortable staying updated with technology trends and understanding how our products evolve.

  • Demonstrated openness, curiosity, and willingness to explore new ideas and methodologies.

  • Willingness and ability to travel domestically and internationally to fulfill job responsibilities.

Additional Information

We offer:

  • Being part of a leading team in an industry in full growth and with great international projection

  • Work modality: Hibrid (2 days a week in person)

  • Holidays: 15 days

  • Medical insurance

  • Language training (English and/or Portuguese)

results.title: Content Writer
results.description:
Where Your Passion Meets Purpose: Empowering Millions through Insurance!



What's Ditto?

At Ditto, our mission is to empower users with a deep understanding of insurance, enabling them to narrow down choices, sidestep common pitfalls, and ultimately make well-informed decisions. From delivering expert insurance advice to facilitating smooth policy purchases and providing dedicated claim support, Ditto ensures a seamless end-to-end insurance experience.

We pioneered the industry-first "No-spam" policy, underscoring our commitment to user-centric solutions. Over the past three years, we've successfully assisted over 300,000 users with personalised insurance advice.

Ditto is part of the Finshots family, a leading financial newsletter boasting a subscriber base of over 500,000 and we are backed by India’s largest stock-broker Zerodha


What do we do at Ditto?

  • We help people buy insurance.
  • We explain health and life insurance in a language users understand
  • We curate and offer personalized recommendations


Who's backing us?

We are funded by Zerodha- India's largest stockbroker


Role and Responsibilities

  • Responsible for creating crisp pieces on finance, insurance, and business
  • You'll be working directly with our SEO/Marketing Head to develop new and engaging content for Indian millennials
  • Ability to simplify financial stories and putting them across in a way that is easy and entertaining to read
  • Creating SEO optimized content with relevant keywords in collaboration with the SEO team
  • Delivering high-quality pieces for Ditto's blog, email etc.
  • You will be required to work out of the office (175/176 Billekahalli,BG Road, Bengaluru, Karnataka - 560076)

What do you need to apply for this position?

  • Good command of the English Language
  • Good storytelling skills
  • The ability to create original pieces of content
  • 1+ year of experience as an Editor, writer, or content creator or a fresher with an exceptional body of work
  • A background in Finance or any experience in simplifying complex topics and presenting them in a way that is entertaining

Perks

  • Competitive salary and comprehensive health insurance
  • Opportunity to lead new content initiatives

Our Interview Process:


We would like to help you minimize your time and efforts.

There are 4 rounds & we will be working towards completing all the rounds within a maximum of 1 weeks time.


Please find the schedule here:


1. HR Introductory Call

2. Task 1

3. Second Interaction

4. Final Managerial Round

Please Note - Beware of fraudulent Recruitment Agents. We do not charge any amount for any given purpose prior to an application for a role or at the time of any ensuing recruitment process. . For any queries, please contact careers@joinditto.in

results.title: Coordinador/a Seguridad y Salud
results.description:
Descripción de la empresa

SGS es la empresa líder mundial en inspección, verificación, ensayos y certificación. Estamos reconocidos como la referencia mundial en calidad e integridad. Con más de 94.000 empleados, contamos con una red de más de 2.600 oficinas y laboratorios en todo el mundo.

Descripción del empleo

Precisamos incorporar una persona para ocupar un puesto híbrido, como Coordinador de Seguridad y Salud en la ejecucción de obras, y además, como Inspector/a OCA en el área de las Inpecciones Reglamentarias. ¿Te parece interesante?

Precisamos que seas Ingeniero/a Técnico con Máster en Prevención de Riesgos y experiencia previa en coordinación de obras.

Internamente te acompañaremos para que te formes y te desarrolles también en el área de las Inspecciones Reglamentarias. ¿No te parece una excelente oportunidad?

Tus funciones serán:

  • Realizar trabajos de Coordinación de seguridad y salud en fase de ejecucción de obras.
  • Redactar estudios y planes de seguridad
  • Realizar inspecciones reglamentarias OCA
  • Realizar revisiones de actividades por ECAC

Requisitos

- Ingeniero/a Técnico industrial o afines

- Máster en PRL

- Experiencia previa como CSS en obras

- Carnet de conducir

Información adicional

  • Formarás parte de una empresa multinacional líder en su sector.
  • Formarás parte de un equipo multicultural donde cada persona es clave para el avance común.
  • En SGS estamos comprometidos con la igualdad de oportunidades de empleo sin discriminar la raza, el color, la ascendencia, la religión, el sexo, el origen nacional, la orientación sexual, la edad, la ciudadanía, el estado civil, la discapacidad y la identidad de género.

results.title: Grid Engineer (w/m/d)
results.description:
Company Description

Statkraft has been making clean energy possible for over a century. That’s what we offer. 125 years of unrivalled expertise in supplying the world with what it needs most. We envision a world that runs entirely on renewable energy. Because in the fight against climate change, we don’t see renewable energy as part of the solution – we believe it must be the solution. With us, you’ll shape a career that is truly forward-facing with many amazing opportunities and offerings to match.

But there’s more work to be done – that’s why we need you to join us.

Job Description

Based in Germany, you will work within our German regional project delivery team - a growing team of multi- discipline engineers, procurement, construction and quality specialists. More broadly, you will be part of an international network of engineering and technical specialists.

As a Grid Engineer, you will be responsible for supporting wind, solar and battery storage projects in Germany, from the early start of development until operation. You will lead on technical, commercial and regulatory issues related to all aspects of grid connections for both distribution and transmission connections.

Your main responsibilities will include:

  • Support the grid connection technical workstream for projects, in support of the project manager and project development team and in collaboration with other technical specialists.
  • Act as technical expert with regard to all grid connection aspects from feasibility through to operation
  • Originate and manage the following relevant to project grid connections: feasibility studies, infrastructure planning, concept and pre-construction engineering,
  • Early phase project involvement in design basis, engineer’s terms of reference, system analysis, value engineering, risk assessment, selection of suitable equipment, constructability, cost and time scheduling
  • Plan the grid connection infrastructure
  • Prepare and quality assure technical specifications and tender documents
  • Technical support in interactions with distribution and transmission grid owners and operators, consultancies, subcontractors and other relevant stakeholders
  • Review all grid connection related documentation
  • Provide engineering support and supervision during the construction phase of projects

Qualifications

  • Degree qualification in Electrical or Power Systems Engineering or similar
  • Several years relevant work experience, including renewable energy project development and construction in Germany
  • Extensive knowledge of grid connection design - proficiency in related software is an advantage.
  • Good understanding of the German grid code and the grid connection agreement process for renewable energy projects in Germany
  • Experience with electrical design of substations and permitting process of a substation
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in German and English
  • Willingness to travel

Additional Information

A career with Statkraft is a career filled with purpose – meaning that every employee is not just making a living, they are making a real difference to the planet, our communities and the future. Together, we work on the front lines of changing the game for renewable energy. From hydrogen development to algorithmic trading and everything in between. We have 125 years of unrivalled expertise in creating the technologies that put ecosystems, communities and our environment first. With us, you’ll shape a career that is truly forward-facing with many amazing opportunities and offerings to match. This includes:

  • Unlimited learning opportunities at various levels of the organisation including Linkedin Learning and inspiring leaderships program like IMD.
  • The chance to grow your career alongside a truly global network of experts, leaders, specialists and graduates from different countries and backgrounds.
  • The opportunity to work somewhere with pride, and to be able to honestly say “My work is contributing to saving the planet”.
  • A work culture that puts emphasis on the individual, offering flexible working solutions, parental leave and work life balance principles (local specific)
  • Monetary childcare subsidy to support you and your family.
  • A focus on fun outside of work, supported by various activity groups such as soccer, yoga, sailing, climbing, boxing, cabin rentals, and much more.
  • Being part of a company proudly certified as a ‘Great Place to Work’.

Statkraft's vision is to renew the way the world is powered. To navigate the complex journey ahead, we need every voice at the table. We therefore work actively to be a diverse and inclusive workplace and welcome all  applicants regardless of background, gender, age, sexual orientation, religious belief, ethnicity, nationality or disability.

Please note: Statkraft manages critical infrastructure and services in several countries. We conduct background checks on qualified applicants before hire.

results.title: Salesforce Marketing Cloud Specialist
results.description:
Company Description

Publicis Sapient is a digital transformation partner helping established organizations get to their future, digitally enabled state, both in the way they work and the way they serve their customers. We help unlock value through a start-up mindset and modern methods, fusing strategy, consulting and customer experience with agile engineering and problem-solving creativity. United by our core values and our purpose of helping people thrive in the brave pursuit of next, our 20,000+ people in 53 offices around the world combine experience across technology, data sciences, consulting and customer obsession to accelerate our clients’ businesses through designing the products and services their customers truly value.

Job Description

  • Assist in the management and maintenance of our CRM system, ensuring data accuracy and completeness.
  • Support the creation and execution of email marketing campaigns and push notifications, using marketing automation tools.
  • Collaborate with the CRM team to segment and target audiences effectively.
  • Monitor and report on key performance metrics related to CRM, email marketing and push notification efforts.
  • Assist in the development and optimization of customer journeys and automated workflows.
  • Provide support in analyzing customer data to identify trends and opportunities.
  • Help in the creation of customer personas and audience segmentation strategies.
  • Stay updated on industry best practices and trends in CRM and Marketing Automation.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or master’s degree in marketing, Business, or a related field.
  • Strong interest in CRM, Marketing Automation, and data-driven marketing.
  • In-depth knowledge of Salesforce Marketing Cloud: Familiarity with the user interface and features, including Email Studio, Mobile Studio, Automation Studio, Journey Builder, Content Builder, Audience Builder and Analytics builder.
  • Proficiency in Automation Studio and Journey Builder: Ability to create and manage automated tasks for email scheduling, data handling, and multichannel marketing activities.
  • Advanced skills in AMPscript and SQL: Ability to use scripting languages to customize email content, create complex dynamization and automation rules, and work with customer data effectively using SQL.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel and PowerPoint.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Strong attention to detail and organizational abilities.
  • Effective communication and teamwork skills.
  • Self-motivated and eager to learn.

Additional Information

As part of our dedication to an inclusive and diverse workforce, Publicis Sapient is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion. We are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures.

results.title: Mid- Senior Architect
results.description:
Company Description

Work with Us. Change the World.

At AECOM, we're delivering a better world. Whether improving your commute, keeping the lights on, providing access to clean water, or transforming skylines, our work helps people and communities thrive. We are the world's trusted infrastructure consulting firm, partnering with clients to solve the world’s most complex challenges and build legacies for future generations.

There has never been a better time to be at AECOM. With accelerating infrastructure investment worldwide, our services are in great demand. We invite you to bring your bold ideas and big dreams and become part of a global team of nearly 50,000 planners, designers, engineers, scientists, digital innovators, program and construction managers and other professionals delivering projects that create a positive and tangible impact around the world.

We're one global team driven by our common purpose to deliver a better world. Join us.

Job Description

AECOM is a global network of experts working with clients, communities, and colleagues to develop and implement innovative solutions to the world’s most complex challenges.

Delivering clean water and energy. Building iconic skyscrapers. Planning new cities. Restoring damaged environments. Connecting people and economies with roads, bridges, tunnels, and transit systems. Designing parks where children play. Helping governments maintain stability and security.

We connect expertise across services, markets, and geographies to deliver transformative outcomes. Worldwide, we design, build, finance, operate and manage projects and programs that unlock opportunities, protect our environment, and improve people’s lives.

We are looking for passionate architects who are driven, proactive and willing to work within a highly dynamic team. They need to hold a bachelor’s degree in architecture/ urban design/ interior design or equivalent qualification.

We are looking for the following skills:

  • Minimum 3 years of experience in a team environment.

  • Good spoken and written English Skills is essential.

  • Experience in BIM/REVIT projects would be highly appreciated.

  • Passion for detailing and solving problems.

  • Adobe Suite (Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, Premiere) and rendering skills would be advantageous. 3d Max/ Unreal and rendering add-ons such as Vray/ Enscape would be highly appreciated.

  • Advanced design tools such as Grasshopper/ Dynamo/Scripting would be highly appreciated

  • Ability to work under own initiative with established timeframes and a high degree of accuracy.

  • Willingness and drive to work collaboratively and integrate in a dynamic team focused on developing together and meeting expectations of our International Clients.

We are expanding our multidisciplinary design team involved in a wide range of projects Worldwide.

The architectural group is looking for colleagues to involve them in projects across various geographies with many of them covering all design phases, from scratch to construction phase and are being developed at the highest level of technical expertise, BIM, and collaborative working. We offer a diversity of tasks to develop your skills from master planning, architecture, interior, presentation, and graphic design as well as possibility to learn new software. If you are driven and focused on your development, coordination and project management are at hand for you no matter your level of experience.

You will be required to:

  • Collaborate closely with local and international teams on the project delivery.

  • Prepare detailed design plans, layouts, elevations, cross-sections, and other associated documents.

  • Prepare documentation to support planning application and maintain up to date portfolio of the building types in cad forms including approved variations.

  • Cooperate with quantity surveyors, engineers, and other design professionals.

  • Ensuring compliance of all architectural guidelines and standards.

Additional Information

About AECOM

AECOM is the world’s trusted infrastructure consulting firm, delivering professional services throughout the project lifecycle – from advisory, planning, design and engineering to program and construction management. On projects spanning transportation, buildings, water, new energy and the environment, our public- and private-sector clients trust us to solve their most complex challenges. Our teams are driven by a common purpose to deliver a better world through our unrivaled technical and digital expertise, a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion, and a commitment to environmental, social and governance priorities. AECOM is a Fortune 500 firm and its Professional Services business had revenue of $14.4 billion in fiscal year 2023. See how we are delivering sustainable legacies for generations to come at aecom.com and @AECOM.

Freedom to Grow in a World of Opportunity

You will have the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office, remote location or at a client site, you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity, entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.

You will help us foster a culture of equity, diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace, where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents, backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.

AECOM provides a wide array of compensation and benefits programs to meet the diverse needs of our employees and their families. We also provide a robust global well-being program. We’re the world’s trusted global infrastructure firm, and we’re in this together – your growth and success are ours too.

Join us, and you’ll get all the benefits of being a part of a global, publicly traded firm – access to industry-leading technology and thinking and transformational work with big impact and work flexibility. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we believe in each person’s potential, and we’ll help you reach yours.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

results.title: Consultor/a de Remediación Ambiental
results.description:
Descripción de la empresa

En AECOM, ofrecemos un mundo mejor.

No importa si se trata de mejorar los traslados, mantener las luces encendidas, dar acceso a agua potable o transformar los horizontes, creemos que cada infraestructura tiene el poder de mejorar las comunidades y la vida de las personas.

Somos la empresa de infraestructura de confianza a nivel mundial, y como tal, reunimos a las mejores personas, ideas y soluciones digitales, así como los mejores conocimientos técnicos. Nos asociamos con nuestros clientes para convertir sus ambiciones en acción y cambiar el mundo para mejorarlo.

Estamos orgullosos de ser reconocidos por nuestro liderazgo, como por ejemplo, al recibir la clasificación Número 1 de Fortune como la Empresa Más Admirada del Mundo en nuestra industria durante dos años consecutivos.

Únete a nosotros y forma parte de un equipo global de casi 50,000 diseñadores, ingenieros, expertos en planeamiento, científicos, administradores de programas y de la construcción y otros profesionales, aportando tu experiencia técnica, tu pasión y tu impulso para realizar proyectos que tengan un impacto positivo y tangible en todo el mundo.

Descripción del empleo

El equipo de Remediación Ambiental en Madrid busca incorporar una persona más en el equipo, debido al crecimiento del área.

Como Consultor/a en el departamento de Remediación Ambiental, la principal misión en el puesto será participar en proyectos de investigación y descontaminación de suelos y aguas subterráneas.

Algunas de las funciones en el puesto:

  • Planificación y ejecución de campañas de campo para la toma de muestras y realización de ensayos.
  • Planificación y supervisión de obras y sistemas de descontaminación.
  • Tratamiento de datos, interpretación de resultados y elaboración de informes.
  • Soporte al Jefe de Proyecto en labores de gestión.

Requisitos

  • Titulación de Máster o Grado en Ingeniería (Ambiental, Química, Minera, Forestal, Civil, Agrícola o Industrial) o Geología, Química, Biología o Ciencias Ambientales, u otro campo de estudio técnico, ambiental o químico.
  • Inglés fluido.
  • Al menos 3-4 años de experiencia previa en un puesto similar.
  • Carnet de conducir y disponibilidad para algunos viajes.

Además, se valorará:

  • Conocimiento y manejo de herramientas SIG, bases de datos y tratamientos estadísticos.
  • Conocimiento y manejo de software auxiliar tipo Surfer.
  • Conocimiento en el desarrollo de modelos matemáticos de flujo tipo Modflow.

Información adicional

Aquí tendrás libertad para crecer en un mundo de oportunidades.

Te daremos la flexibilidad que necesitas para hacer tu mejor trabajo. Independientemente de que trabajes en una oficina de AECOM, en un sitio remoto o en las instalaciones de un cliente, siempre estarás trabajando en un entorno dinámico en el que se fomentará tu integridad, tu espíritu emprendedor y tu mentalidad pionera.

Debido a la aceleración de las inversiones en infraestructura en todo el mundo, nuestros servicios tienen una gran demanda, y nunca ha habido un mejor momento para estar en AECOM. Únete a nosotros y goza de todas las ventajas de ser parte de una empresa global que cotiza en bolsa: acceso a la tecnología y al pensamiento de vanguardia en el sector y a un trabajo transformador de gran impacto y con flexibilidad laboral.

Te impulsaremos para que crezcas y te desarrolles profesionalmente con nosotros a través de nuestros programas de desarrollo técnico y profesional, así como las diversas oportunidades profesionales. Nosotros creemos en el liderazgo a todos los niveles. No importa qué lugar ocupes en la organización, tú puedes tener un impacto duradero en los proyectos en los que trabajas, en los equipos y comités en los que participas y en nuestros negocios.

AECOM ofrece una gran variedad de programas de compensaciones y beneficios para satisfacer las diversas necesidades de nuestros empleados y sus familias. También ofrecemos un sólido programa de bienestar global. Somos la empresa de infraestructura de confianza a nivel mundial, y estamos juntos en esto: tu crecimiento y tu éxito son también los nuestros.

Somos una empresa que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades laborales, y como tal, creemos en el potencial de cada persona y te ayudaremos a alcanzar el suyo.

Únete a nosotros, ¡y empecemos!

Somos la empresa de infraestructura de confianza a nivel mundial, y como tal, reunimos a las mejores personas, ideas y soluciones digitales, así como los mejores conocimientos técnicos. Nos asociamos con nuestros clientes para convertir sus ambiciones en acción y cambiar el mundo para mejorarlo.

Estamos orgullosos de ser reconocidos por nuestro liderazgo, como por ejemplo, al recibir la clasificación Número 1 de Fortune como la Empresa Más Admirada del Mundo en nuestra industria durante dos años consecutivos.

Únete a nosotros y forma parte de un equipo global de casi 50,000 diseñadores, ingenieros, expertos en planeamiento, científicos, administradores de programas y de la construcción y otros profesionales, aportando tu experiencia técnica, tu pasión y tu impulso para realizar proyectos que tengan un impacto positivo y tangible en todo el mundo.

Descripción del empleo

El equipo de Remediación Ambiental en Bilbao busca incorporar una persona más en el equipo, debido al crecimiento del área.

Como Consultor/a en el departamento de Remediación Ambiental, la principal misión en el puesto será participar en proyectos de investigación y descontaminación de suelos y aguas subterráneas.

Algunas de las funciones en el puesto:

  • Planificación y ejecución de campañas de campo para la toma de muestras y realización de ensayos.
  • Planificación y supervisión de obras y sistemas de descontaminación.
  • Tratamiento de datos, interpretación de resultados y elaboración de informes.
  • Soporte al Jefe de Proyecto en labores de gestión.

Requisitos

  • Titulación de Máster o Grado en Ingeniería (Ambiental, Química, Minera, Forestal, Civil, Agrícola o Industrial) o Geología, Química, Biología o Ciencias Ambientales, u otro campo de estudio técnico, ambiental o químico.
  • Inglés fluido.
  • Al menos 3-4 años de experiencia previa en un puesto similar.
  • Carnet de conducir y disponibilidad para algunos viajes.

Además, se valorará:

  • Conocimiento y manejo de herramientas SIG, bases de datos y tratamientos estadísticos.
  • Conocimiento y manejo de software auxiliar tipo Surfer.
  • Conocimiento en el desarrollo de modelos matemáticos de flujo tipo Modflow.

Información adicional

Aquí tendrás libertad para crecer en un mundo de oportunidades.

Te daremos la flexibilidad que necesitas para hacer tu mejor trabajo. Independientemente de que trabajes en una oficina de AECOM, en un sitio remoto o en las instalaciones de un cliente, siempre estarás trabajando en un entorno dinámico en el que se fomentará tu integridad, tu espíritu emprendedor y tu mentalidad pionera.

Debido a la aceleración de las inversiones en infraestructura en todo el mundo, nuestros servicios tienen una gran demanda, y nunca ha habido un mejor momento para estar en AECOM. Únete a nosotros y goza de todas las ventajas de ser parte de una empresa global que cotiza en bolsa: acceso a la tecnología y al pensamiento de vanguardia en el sector y a un trabajo transformador de gran impacto y con flexibilidad laboral.

Te impulsaremos para que crezcas y te desarrolles profesionalmente con nosotros a través de nuestros programas de desarrollo técnico y profesional, así como las diversas oportunidades profesionales. Nosotros creemos en el liderazgo a todos los niveles. No importa qué lugar ocupes en la organización, tú puedes tener un impacto duradero en los proyectos en los que trabajas, en los equipos y comités en los que participas y en nuestros negocios.

AECOM ofrece una gran variedad de programas de compensaciones y beneficios para satisfacer las diversas necesidades de nuestros empleados y sus familias. También ofrecemos un sólido programa de bienestar global. Somos la empresa de infraestructura de confianza a nivel mundial, y estamos juntos en esto: tu crecimiento y tu éxito son también los nuestros.

Somos una empresa que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades laborales, y como tal, creemos en el potencial de cada persona y te ayudaremos a alcanzar el suyo.

Únete a nosotros, ¡y empecemos!
